faqs.question: Hvor mye koster denne eiendommen?
faqs.answer: €339,900. This 3-bedroom bungalow in Parque del Mediterraneo offers premium specification at €3,777 per square meter—40% less than comparable properties on Spanish islands, making it exceptional value for retirement buyers seeking both lifestyle and investment returns.

faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca bra for pensjonister?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Costa Blanca has become Europe's premier retirement destination, with 300+ annual sunshine days, year-round mild climate, excellent healthcare access, and an established international expat community. Pilar de La Horadada specifically attracts British and European retirees seeking authentic Spanish living with English-speaking infrastructure and genuine community integration rather than isolated expat enclaves.

faqs.question: Kan utlendinger kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign nationals can freely purchase property in Spain without residency requirements or work permits. The process involves obtaining a Spanish tax ID number (NIE), hiring a solicitor to conduct due diligence, and managing legal documentation through Spain's established property transfer system. Many British retirees successfully navigate this process annually.

faqs.question: Hva koster det å kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect approximately 8-10% additional costs including: 6% property transfer tax, 1.5-2% notary and registration fees, and 1-2% solicitor fees. Ongoing costs include annual property tax (approximately 0.4-1.1% of property value), community fees (if applicable), and utilities. These costs are significantly lower than UK equivalents, contributing to overall value.

faqs.question: Kan jeg få boliglån i Spania som utlending?
faqs.answer: Yes, major Spanish banks and some international lenders offer mortgages to foreign buyers, typically up to 70-80% of property value with a 20-30 year term. Interest rates are currently 3.5-4.5%. Many British retirees finance purchases through Spanish mortgages or arrange overseas mortgages from UK lenders offering international portfolios. Your solicitor can recommend lenders specializing in international clients.

faqs.question: Hvordan er været på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys a Mediterranean climate with year-round warmth: average 19°C winters (frost-free) and 28°C summers, with 300+ annual sunshine days. Rainfall is minimal (concentrated December-April), and the region benefits from refreshing sea breezes moderating summer heat. This climate supports outdoor living throughout the year—a primary advantage for retirement lifestyle.

faqs.question: Hvor langt er det fra Norge til Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport, 45 minutes from Pilar de La Horadada, offers direct flights to UK airports (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Bristol) taking approximately 2.5 hours. Budget airlines provide regular £30-80 return fares, making weekend trips home feasible. This proximity allows retirees to maintain UK connections while based permanently in Spain.

faqs.question: Hva er levekostnadene på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living is approximately 30-40% lower than UK equivalents: grocery shopping, dining, utilities, and services cost substantially less. Healthcare is significantly cheaper than private UK care. A comfortable retirement budget for a couple runs €1,500-2,000 monthly, covering all living expenses including utilities, food, transport, and leisure activities—representing exceptional value compared to UK retirement costs.

faqs.question: Why is this bungalow priced higher than area average?
faqs.answer: At €3,777/m², this property sits above Pilar de La Horadada's €2,200/m² average because it features premium specification finishes, quality construction, and location within Parque del Mediterraneo's established gated community. The premium reflects current market standards for well-finished new properties, while remaining 40% below Spanish island market prices—delivering value despite above-average area pricing.

faqs.question: Hva er leieinntektspotensialet for denne eiendommen?
faqs.answer: Comparable 3-bedroom properties in Pilar de La Horadada generate €800+ per week during peak season (June-September), with growing off-season rental demand from visiting family and friends seeking affordable Mediterranean holidays. Many owners rent 10-14 weeks annually, generating €8,000-11,000 supplementary income while enjoying personal use remaining months.

faqs.question: Is Pilar de La Horadada a good location within Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Yes, Pilar de La Horadada offers exceptional positioning: peaceful, underdeveloped character combined with complete modern infrastructure, established expat community, healthcare access, and proximity to beaches and attractions. Compared to busier coastal towns (Torrevieja, Benidorm), it maintains authentic Spanish atmosphere while offering English-friendly services—ideal for retirees seeking balanced living.
